name: No Dice Magazine issue 8
description:
It's the biggest No Dice Magazine yet: sixty pages bursting with Berlin football! 

In this issue:

- Stephen Glennon, Ian Stenhouse and Jacob Sweetman on the road with Tennis Borussia Berlin
- Jacob Sweetman on Sparta Lichtenberg
- Stephen Glennon on BFC Dynamo
- David Tunnicliffe on 1.FC Union in Europe
- Michael Kliegl on Turbine Potsdam v North Korea
- Christian Wolter on worker's football in Berlin, 1909-1933 (part 1)

name: No Dice Magazine issue 7
description:
In this issue of No Dice:

-Jacob Sweetman on Rocco Teichmann
-Axel Gustke on SC Union 06
-Stephen Glennon on VfB Hermsdorf
-Ian Stenhouse on the Berlin Freizeitliga
-From the No Dice match report archives: BFC Dynamo's cup win over Lichtenberg 47 and Babelsberg's friendly meeting with FC United of Manchester

name: No Dice Magazine issue 6
description:
Here comes Issue 6!

You can find the following delights within:
- Stephen Glennon on Hertha Amateure's incredible route to the DFB Pokal final in 1993
- Jacob Sweetman on the future of BFC Viktoria 1889 - Berlin's future third power?
- An Ian Stenhouse photo essay on the Winterpause
- Will Studdert on TuS Makkabi, Berlin's only Jewish football club
- Tommy George on the recent actions of the 1.FC Union ultras
- A series of photo profiles on Hertha BSC players by Maria Köhler
- Part 2 of Christian Wolter's look at the history of Berlin's stadia, including Hertha's famous old ground, the Plumpe

name: No Dice Magazine issue 5
description:
Goodness gracious, how time flies! It's No Dice Issue 5 already, and we've got some extra-special contributors lined up for the biggest issue to date. Here's a run-down on what treats lie in store for those who pick up No Dice Magazine Issue 5 for just €5:

- Jacob Sweetman on Edwin Dutton
- Stephen Glennon and Ian Stenhouse on Berlin-Liga high flyers BSV Hürtürkel
- Christian Wolter, author of the marvellous 'Rasen der Leidenshaften' with a historical overview of the development of football stadia in Berlin
- Will Studdert on the fan scene at Babelsberg
- Photo essays from Stefanie Lamm and Johannes Brattke
- Another beautiful Emily Sweetman illustration
- Steve Tattum, a player for Freiberger Lebensmittel in the Betriebsliga, on life in the lower leagues.

Don't forget to come along to our No Dice Issue 5 launch party! Details here: https://www.facebook.com/events/302486193200801/

name: No Dice Magazine issue 4
description: It’s been a year, and we are proud to  announce the launch of issue 4 of No Dice Magazine. It’s the best one yet, with Jacob on Tijani Belaid, Stephen on players caught between Union and Dynamo, David from Ostklassiker on problems with Nazis, Stefanie from Unrund‘s beautiful photos, Felix from Groundhopping Etc on football in Wedding and, of course, another stunning photo essay from Ian.
